required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Oxygen Concentration During Alveolar Recruitment on Absorption Atelectasis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of oxygen concentration during alveolar recruitment on absorption ateletasis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperative (at the end of operation, before emergence)
primary_outcome.description: The score is calculated by adding up the 12 individual quadrant scores assessed using lung ultrasound. Each quadrant score ranges from 0 (minimal atelectasis)~3 (severe atelectasis), so the maximum total score is 36.

secondary_outcome.description: The score is calculated by adding up the 12 individual quadrant scores assessed using lung ultrasound. Each quadrant score ranges from 0 (minimal atelectasis)~3 (severe atelectasis), so the maximum total score is 36.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraoperative partial pressure of arterial oxygen/fraction of inspired oxygen ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Partial pressure of arterial oxygen/fraction of inspired oxygen ratio

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative partial pressure of arterial oxygen/fraction of inspired oxygen ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Partial pressure of arterial oxygen/fraction of inspired oxygen ratio
respiratory infection, respiratory failure, pleural effusion, atelectasis, pneumothorax, atelectasis, bronchospasm, aspiration pneumonitis

arm_group.description: Alveolar recruitment is performed with 100% oxygen concentration at specific time points.
Alveolar recruitment is performed with 40% oxygen concentration at specific time points.

intervention.description: Alveolar recruitment is performed with 100% oxygen concentration after general anesthesia induction, after position change to Trendelenburg, after position change to supine, and at the end of operation.

Alveolar recruitment is performed with 40% oxygen concentration after general anesthesia induction, after position change to Trendelenburg, after position change to supine, and at the end of operation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing laparoscopic obstetric or colon surgery with Trendelenburg position
Exclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status IV or more
- Severe cardiovascular disease
- Severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, emphysema
- History of pneumothorax, bullae
- History of lung resection surgery
- Conversion to laparotomy
- Refusal to participate
